report.title: All User Sites
report.description: A list of sites that are associated with all users for a website (my sites). Example use: Allows administrators to maintain 'my sites' for other users.
report.query: SELECT #columns# FROM person_attribute_values pav LEFT JOIN locations l on l.id = pav.int_value AND l.deleted = false LEFT JOIN people p on p.id = pav.person_id AND p.deleted=false LEFT JOIN locations_websites lw ON lw.location_id=l.id AND lw.deleted=false LEFT JOIN users u ON u.person_id=p.id #joins# WHERE 1=1 #filters# AND pav.deleted=false AND pav.person_attribute_id=#person_site_attr_id# AND #website_filter#
report.params:
l.id=#location_id#
l.location_type_id in (#location_type_ids#)
--Note am using the name the_user_id as just using user_id seems to pickup the current user's id automatically which isn't what we want at all
u.id=#the_user_id#
report.columns:
--note: Do not rename this as user_id as there appears to be automatic code associated with the website filter that looks for that name
--Default to invisible as this field was added later and don't want to affect old reports
